website_summaries.verdict: Elevated bar is perfect for taller users or for a wider range of motion.
pros: Premium construction and bar couplers for excellent stability for up to 300 pounds
Can be used for floor exercises as well
The bar is elevated above the wall trim for more headroom and better range of motion
cons: Attaches over door moldings, so it may not fit all doorways

customer_reviews.title: Seemed sturdy and well-made at first glance
customer_reviews.text: Seemed sturdy and well-made at first glance, however the holes drilled through the metal bars are not parallel - causing the bolts to sit at odd angles and making impossible to assemble or use (see photos). Disappointed and expected better craftsmanship from a product this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great idea, but someone needs to make one that ...
customer_reviews.text: Please do yourself a favor and avoid this poorly manufactured product. If i hadn’t already thrown the box away, this piece of junk would be on its way back to amazon. The “s” shaped pieces are different sizes and the holes are drilled at different angles on the straight beam. After having to use a drill to expand the holes in order to accommodate the bolts, the whole apparatus sits off kilter in the doorway. It looks ridiculous and unsafe. It’s a great idea, but someone needs to make one that actually works. Avoid this thing. Don’t waste your money. If i could give it zero stars, i would.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Connors

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pull up bar in terms of versatility and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pull up bar in terms of versatility and quality. It is completely sturdy and should last for several years. The nuts and bolts seem securely fastened, so I don't think they will loosen over time like most pull up bars. I will update this review if it does. The price at 60$, however, is pretty steep which is why I'm docking 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Maglalang

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar is built like a tank. Seriously, probably the best one that I have used. The two cross bars (lower one that goes against the door and the upper one for the wide grip are each one solid piece. The item itself is 5 kilos (11 lbs). Handled my 220lbs without any issues. Be aware that it is pretty big and that you need to make sure you have some head clearance or else you'll bump your head to the ceiling. Solid item.
customer_reviews.author: Khai D.

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate fit.
customer_reviews.text: I measured my doorway to make sure this would fit as my doorway is fairly narrow. It is 24" and this said it would fit a 24" doorway, but it is too big. Be great to have a more accurate measurements on the actual components.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Lundstrom

customer_reviews.title: Installation and Door Size Options and it's Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I am Super Happy with this purchase. I am really bad at writing reviews but I needed to with this one. The doors in my new Apt are ADA (American Disability) sized and my last pull-up rig would not work. This one is Fantastic, and even with the "Made in China" it is very sturdy and well built. I hoof out at 160 so not really straining anything but myself. :-) I recommend it for both standard and ADA doors.. just install the extensions... Cheers..
customer_reviews.author: Family Network

customer_reviews.title: Missing a Part and may dent your door frame trim.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews stated there were parts missing. Well me too. One of the cap nuts that secure the plastic cross brace didn't have any threads cut into it. And it seems to be a fine thread count or metric. Couldn't tell which one. Luckily I found a long enough bolt and nut so that I could complete the construction and start to use the bar. So far after one evening of seeing if it works, it does. It also dents in the wood door trim from the pressure it exerts on the door frame. Overall I guess it is ok. I certainly need to work on my pull ups. They are more difficult than I remember.
customer_reviews.author: JR Means

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to assemble, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This pull-up bar exceeded my expectations. It has a range of handgrips for the whole family and easily holds 230lbs (plus even greater dynamic forces - kids jumping up to grab bar). The elevated design allows tall people to use, and the position of bar outside of door frame makes it easy to use without worrying about hitting your head on the door frame. The tradeoff is that the door can't be closed with the chin-up bar in place, and it is rather bulky when assembled. We leave ours in place, but it is easy mount and unmount (2 seconds?) if you want to store it between uses.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Firm

customer_reviews.title: Nice pull up bar with plenty of grips for different ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice pull up bar with plenty of grips for different pull up positions. Grips seem sturdy enough and do not slip. -1 star because the frame isn't completely straight/came a little warped (doesn't seem to make a huge difference). -1 star because it did put dents in my door frame where the bar rests against it (the padding could be better where it rests against the door).
customer_reviews.author: .4ngryToasters

customer_reviews.title: This bar is easily strong enough to hold 215 lbs. and is very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: This bar is easily strong enough to hold 215 lbs. It also keeps my 6'1" far enough off the ground to keep my feet from touching. It has caused some minor damage to the pine trim around my doorway, but I still think it is mostly a good design. If you would like to prevent damage to your own doorway trim, try inserting a small square piece of Luan or other 1/4" plywood in between the door frame and the two points on the left and right where the bar rests on the trim.
customer_reviews.author: Greg G.

customer_reviews.title: WELL MADE, HEAVY DUTY
customer_reviews.text: Very nice well-made heavy duty pull up bar. The handles are elevated so you can reach up and grab them... you don't have to squat down to use them. You can flip it over and do push ups on it. I think you can also hook it under the bed and use it for sit ups. although I haven't done this. I had one of these years ago, and just loved it. I sold it when I moved, and have regretted it ever since. I was really excited to find this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dean E. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Glad I went for this model over some of the less expensive options. Sits in the doorway very securely. No damage to our door frames.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit any doorway in the house
customer_reviews.text: The bar that was sent to me did not have an adjustable width as shown in the video. There was only one hole and not three to adjust the width. The bar sent to me would not fit a door wall thickness of 4 1/2 inches. After struggling to get the thing together because not all the slip washers were included and one end cap smashed, it didn't work. What a big disappointment. I do not recommend this bar. I am returning the bar tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: as the padding could be better. Thats my only complain
customer_reviews.text: High quality pull-up bar for your doorframe. It it quite heavy, therefore be careful when you remove it. If it fell it can hurt. Also, make sure that your frame, as well the wall is from high quality. It can damage the frame a little, as the padding could be better. Thats my only complain. Training wise it gives you many possible grips and it feels always safe. It is worse to pay the extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: TheCritic

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a variety of pull-up bars over the years. Currently, and without access to bolt a bar to an overhead beam, this is by far the best bar I've ever owned for use on a doorway. It's solid, sturdy, well designed, and doesn't damage the door frame in any way. It allows for chin-ups, neutral grip (for when injured), as well as near (straight) and far (angled) grip pull-ups. Truly an excellent product and well worth the money. I'm 5'10", 165lbs, and have done pull-ups daily for 30 years to offset the pain from several compressed discs. So I know a good bar.
customer_reviews.author: Limey Smokejumper

customer_reviews.title: I am in a good mood today and feel generous
customer_reviews.text: The pads for the door frame are very soft and the rip. I purchased it for my son, under 100lb and with one week of usage it has already marked the door frame and the pads are damaged. I tried to returned it, but the new one moth return policy of Amazon will not allow me to return it. I am in a good mood today and feel generous, so I am giving this product a 2 stars instead of 1
customer_reviews.author: Julian Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Company stands behind their product
customer_reviews.text: Best pull up bar I have used. When the plastic washer broke I was able to contact the company and they shipped a replacement piece at no cost. Very sturdy equipment considering I am 215 lbs. and can crank out 3 reps of 10 without the slightest budge from the pull up bar after the replacement piece came. Fits right on the door jab exactly as shown on the site. I probably don't even need the plastic washers because it still worked without them.
customer_reviews.author: IT in  VA

customer_reviews.title: Best Door Mounted Pull-Up Bar I've Ever Owned.
customer_reviews.text: The feature that stands out the most to me is the increased range of motion because of the way the bars are curved up so they are above the doorway. Most door mounted Pull-Up bars are too low so if feels awkward when you are hanging down from them and your knees are almost touching the floor. Plus this is extremely sturdy for my 190 lb. frame.
customer_reviews.author: James Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Critical arc washers fail immediately on assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble but, the bi-direction arc washers supplied immediately disintegrated and split apart when you tighten the bolts to secure the pieces together. This problem has been reported multiple times by various buyers so you'd think the manufacturer would do something about it but, nope, they haven't. Look at the picture and you'll see the blue washer just split apart. Not sure what to do now. UPDATE : I read a solution to the arc washers splitting was to use a zip tie to "collar" the perimeter and prevent the compression spread/split and - it really worked !!!
customer_reviews.author: TwistedLeather

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: I am currently a 3-peat Ultimate Body Press customer and I must say that their products always deliver. Way better than a $20 special and the door guards are awesome in protecting the door frame. I have dedicated equipment for my bodyweight training but for on the go/mobile gym, I use the dip station and body weight trainer (along with the pull up bar now) since they don't take up much space at all and don't feel cheap for the price paid. Thanks for making such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: prgr4m

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: After my gym closed I ordered this...and waited a month for it to arrive. It broke after my first use. The small nylon bushings that go between where you grip and where the bar attaches to the door broke. It’s now metal on metal. It’s going back. What a complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this product, customer service is non existent
customer_reviews.text: These little spacers as shown in the photo add the rigidity needed for the stability of this device. It's a good unit until one splits and shots across the room while you're using the bar.. not a fun event seeing how explosively it ejected and landed 30 ft away. Customer service is horrible with replying to emails from their website. Been three weeks with two separate emails, no response. Find another product.
customer_reviews.author: clinton james

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE PRICE! BETTER THAN THE REST!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pull-up bar!! My favorite part is how it extends up higher than normal pull-up bars. I’m 5’6” and I gotta jump a bit to get up there but I like that. I can do so many different exercises with this one than a regular pull-up bar because you are away from the doorway plus my feet hang down and I have to fully pull myself up. I bet tall people would love this too. Yes it’s a little pricier than other pull-up bars but trust me it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Yelena

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar is pretty decent. It works well for me and fits in my doorway. It holds my weight which was 180 when I first bought it but a heavier guy on it makes it bend a little. Not sure how it will hold up long term for a heavier guy. My only complaint is that I had it on my door frame for only a few days and when I took it off the pads that sit on the vertical parts of the door frame took the paint off my trim. I didn't think it would do that from just a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Era

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality, super cheap assembly tools, no insteuctions!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the pull up bar is alright, however the tools and wrenches included were all destroyed and worn out half way through the assembly!!! And one page of confusing picture instruction with one image and no details how to put together. Hopefully the sellers will read this and try to improve these. Otherwise, it works fine (after I used my own tools from work!)
customer_reviews.author: Payam L.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: TLDR, great product. Highly recommend it. Glad I bought it. I had two fears about ordering a pull-up bar. The first was putting it together. The second was the overall quality of the product. Putting this item together was very simple. All the parts and tools were provided. (Seems odd to say, but we've all ordered something missing parts!) It was finished in about 30min. Using this pull-up bar is great. It fits my door perfectly and is very solid. I can get a solid workout without anything shifting, clicking, rattling or sliding around. The extension away from the door is another bonus, allowing me to get a complete pull up, not a half chin-up.
customer_reviews.author: Howard M.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit on standard thicker door jambs.
customer_reviews.text: My doorway is 9 inches thick and the top board is 6 inches wide. This wont fit. The top resting bar on the product this needs to be atleast 2 inches higher to reach the top of the board, and the curved U bar needs to have at least 2 to 3 inches of extra space inside the U. I dont live in a special apt. They need to make it fit wider doorways or have extension for the top and more holes in the U bars for thicker doorjambs. Disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Good but foam grips slip
customer_reviews.text: I am a female that is 5'2" and I use a small step stool to get up on this bar. I like that it has not damaged my door frame as I'm a renter and can be taken down and put on the ground for more exercises (like triceps). The instructions seemed incorrect so I ended up watching a Youtube video for the correct assembly. Main issue: the foam grips slip when I'm using this which sucks.
customer_reviews.author: A lady in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, definitely worth its price since cheaper ones don’t deliver the same experience you’ll have with this bar. It is a day and night in comparison to the cheaper alternatives out there that have a limited range of motion. This extended pull up bar is sturdy and well designed. Putting it together was a piece of cake and it took 10 mins max. Pro tip: put a paper towel on the back where the bar attaches to your door’s top rim to avoid black stains due to prolonged use.
customer_reviews.author: Serdar

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Installs and put away easily
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Installs and put away easily. My son and I both us it. He is almost 6’3” and I am 214 lbs. it handles us both with no issues. I highly recommend this. You have 4 grip choices to work different muscle groups. You can easily add a band (separate purchase) to it to help you develop muscle strength.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not as sturdy as could be
customer_reviews.text: I like the added range of vertical motion due to the elevated bar a lot!! However, the bar moves sideways more than it should - for example if I shift my weight from one arm to the other. Also it is slightly bent when assembled, so it's not 100% horizontal.
customer_reviews.author: volterr

customer_reviews.title: Missing washers, shaky assembly
customer_reviews.text: The construction sheet shows 6 places you're supposed to use the spring washers but only lists and provides 2 of them. Doesn't make sense. Assembled anyway because washers aren't mission critical. Whole assembly feels a little shaky and gives side to side. Maybe the washers would help, maybe not.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Use a zip-tie to support the arc washers!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic compression joints (Arc washers) don’t stand up to the pressure of tightening the bolts. Two of them stress fractures and split open making the joint unprotected. I tried contacting customer support who never got back to me. Instead I took matters into my own hands and use a zip-tie to support the outer circumference of the arc-washer while still allowing it the ability to softener the flex of the bars when a load was applied. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Link

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine fitness buster
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my fiancé who still isn't going to his gym. It is great well constructed pull up bar. It hooks onto the door frame of newer houses. We live in a 100 year old house an the top of the door frames are NOT standard height. We are lucky enough to have an additional sun room off of the kitchen and are able to use it there.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Fits Doorways With Very Thick Frames
customer_reviews.text: The frame around my door is easily six inches and this fits just fine. It's fairly sturdy though not "rock" solid. The padding on the arms that comes into contact with the frame does wear out rather quickly and if you don't place extra padding around the contact points with the door frame some of the paint will chip off eventually. The paint can be easily replaced and the frame doesn't appear to have taken any physical damage. Range of motion is rather good and the bar lends itself well toward pull up attachments from Rogue and such. Overall I'd recommend as long as you're comfortable with the drawbacks.
customer_reviews.author: Elisif the Fair

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy (240 lbs) and the door frame where I have this set up is actually kind of flimsy but I've been able to do things with this bar that really impressed me. There were no instructions in the box but I was able to quickly and effortlessly assemble it by just looking at the picture on the box. The thing that impressed me the most is that this thing holds me up even when I'm trying to do "Ninja Warrior" tricks on it. It's not just good for pull ups, it holds up like a champ no matter what you throw at it. I am definitely very happy that I upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I went to parachute school when I was younger and chin ups/pull ups have always been a big part of my fitness routine. This doorway set is amazing. I have tried many others but I have never been as happy with a doorway bar/set as I am with this one. I must have owned at least a dozen different bars over the years. The Bar is very sturdy. Easy to put together and easy to tear down. It does not bend at all when doing chin ups/pull ups. Can easily be used for leg lifts. Fantastic bar.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Wow... Absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I am 6’2” so the best feature of this bar is how high above the door frame that the bars are located. I’ve used other bars and had to get into a kneeling position to start my pull ups. That’s not good at all. This bar is hands down better than the bar I was using at the gym, and I don’t have to wait for clowns at the gym to finish hogging it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Great pullup bar worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Works great, very sturdy, nice to have close, neutral and wide grip to accommodate most forms of pullups. Holds rings as well! My door frame was a little to small for the pullup bar, but a couple of 2x4s fixed it easily and now it doesn't rub against the door frame, either.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Faulty part
customer_reviews.text: It is ironic, in a way, that often the least expensive part in a product can render the product defective. In the case of the two pull-up bar sets that I purchased, the tube-to-tube plastic saddles are failing. I assume that the cause is continued cross-linking of the polymer bonds resulting in brittleness of the plastic. You can plan on 1+ years with no issue before the plastic parts begin to fail. If not for this issue I would rate the bars 5-stars: they are near-perfect in every other way and I still use.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hollimon

customer_reviews.title: Best doorway no-screw pullup bar
customer_reviews.text: I have used many pullup bars over the years, including several of these doorway style bars that do not get screwed into the door frame. This is without question the best doorway style no-screw bar I have ever used. It's sturdy and very comfortable for doing pullups without having to screw mounting brackets into the door frame. While I do prefer bars that are screwed in, my current living situation prevents me from using one of those, so this is my best option for now. I am very pleased with this bar.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Missing and damaged parts
customer_reviews.text: Unit came with missing arc washer and knots, and the end cap for the bar was damaged. Very disappointed in this product, should have bought the cheaper ones I was looking at first.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Was not finished being manufactured - Obvious rush job - No quality control
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this pull up bar and waited forever to get it. Sorry to see that they had not drilled any of the holes on one of the arms and pads where not aligned. Just looked really rushed and like they just did whatever it took to get it out the door. I'm sure that it's a good product if they had even just a little quality control.
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: BEST Bar you'll EVER BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bar a year and a half ago. I've made huge gains with it. I use not only for pull ups, but I also can connect bands and straps to it as well --making for variety in my training. The elevation allows for a fuller range of motion when extending the arms at the bottom. With my previous bar...my knees were on the ground, which was annoying. I use it in a lot of my YouTube videos on my Vegan Fitness Goddess channel. Oh! And it was very easy to put together! To me about 15 minutes. Easy to read instructions. It's a sturdy bar...I weigh between 160 and 180 depending on the time of year.
customer_reviews.author: VeganFitnessGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Great Pull-up Bar
customer_reviews.text: This is the best doorway pull-up bar I have ever owned. It was easy to assemble and yet feels very sturdy (as sturdy as your door frame, of course). There are at least five different grip positions (including neutral grip). It has grips on two different levels and so allows one to practice transitioning between two bars. All in all, it is a great pull-up bar for the money.
customer_reviews.author: TheTurtle

customer_reviews.title: Right where i can't miss it
customer_reviews.text: I dislike nothing. It is sturdy as pictured, and hangs up just high enough so I'm not walking into it but can jump to get (based on MY door casing dimensions). We're 5'8" and 5'1", respectively. I have it hung where I can't possibly forget to give a pull as I pass through the doorway !
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Strong and works well, make sure your door  frame is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar is sturdy and strong. I tend to go between 185 - 200 pounds and the pull up bar works great. If you use the elevated part, make sure your door frame is sturdy because the extra leverage will stress it. I like the elevated part for wider grips and stretching (I'm 6 foot).
customer_reviews.author: Ed Sakabu

customer_reviews.title: Broke!
customer_reviews.text: Blue washers already broke off during basic pullups. Not considered safe at this point and the manufacturer has not responded on replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Dbisn6x0

customer_reviews.title: Gives Much More Clearance Than Many Others
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pullup bar because the handle position was significantly higher than most other styles. It does not disappoint! I can do a full pullup with minimal leg bending and much less than with my previous model. The only negative I have found so far is the hard plastic that braces against the door frame. It can leave marking on your door frame. I use small adhesive pads at the contact points to prevent the marking (normally for furniture feet).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Lets me hang with my legs straight
customer_reviews.text: nice product, hardware pack was missing a lock washer and the wrenches do not really fit the nuts, but it went together smoothly aand supported my 230 pounds without straining or bending. Packaging was good and it arrived without any major dings on the cardboard. Wrenches scratched the paint when tightning the nuts, but since most of them are on the topside it wont be seen from below
customer_reviews.author: DruAdams81

customer_reviews.title: Nice elevation, strong and stable
customer_reviews.text: The main reason for buying this over the other ones available is that the pull up bars are higher than normal. For me personally, I think this makes this particular one the best on the market. It is stable enough when doing the pull ups. Will it be as stable as a pull up bar attached to the wall, probably not but for what it is, it's worth the money. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Louis B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth paying more for a bar that is raised above the height of the door frame instead of below.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this bar is above the door frame so I don't have to squat every time I grab the bar. Just wrap the ends of the bar with an old t-shirt where it is in contact with the door frame to prevent damage. Not worth taking a star off because that minor damage is likely unavoidable no matter which bar you buy.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Height and extended arms make the difference
customer_reviews.text: This is much better for me than the popular one I was using. The extended arms makes it more natural and useful in a doorway allowing for full arm extensions. Also the design works better for dips that the others which are generally to low to the floor to really do a dip.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Wall safe. Great quality. Gym friend approved 2.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. And pretty wide already. I didn't need to add extenders like I thought. My friend came over and was impressed. He has some other bar and quickly gave a better rating. Btw im 185lbs and no damage 2 wall or frame in 2 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: TwiggyB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this and we love it, in just a couple weeks you can already see a difference in him and myself. I just use it multiple times a day, I am 120 lbs and 5'3 and I have gotten up to 12 pull ups in a row, and just a few weeks ago I couldn't even do 5. There are so many uses for this pull up bar.
customer_reviews.author: dannarae707

customer_reviews.title: HAVE ALL HARDWARE NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: Product did not come with the correct amount of hardware to assemble correctly. Missing/wrong -4 (55mm) Allen bolts not with kit -flat washers too small and do not fit any bolts -Allen bolts length was wrong as I need 4” long bots and not 1”... Terrible assembly process and instructions for the product and price.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be sturdy but missing one of the carriage bolts
customer_reviews.text: I received the item and when I checked to see if all of the parts were there, it was missing 1 65mm Carriage Bolt. I contacted the company and they said to send them an email and they would send the part out. I will see how quickly they respond to the missing part that I need. I put most of it together to see how it would fit in my doorway and it seems well built and sturdy. Hopefully they will send the part out quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiiboy58

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This has easily been my best purchase since the COVID-19 lockdown. The bar lets you do three different types of workouts (Traditional Pull-ups, Chinups, and Hammer Grip pullups) when you mount it on there door. You can also do pushups & dips when it's on the ground. I still haven't figured out how to do any ab workouts with the bar but that's ok. Great variey of workouts for what you pay!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expected great things, but very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. Expected great things (as per the reviews) but once assembled the bar was wonky. Assuming this must be one-off. Returning for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr T C Vos

customer_reviews.title: The blue washers break easily.
customer_reviews.text: The blue washers between the metal all broke. I emailed the company to send replacement washers but no response for over a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Parts and Schematic Differ Slightly as What I Received
customer_reviews.text: I found that this item is quite easy to assemble and fairly sturdy; however, the prepackaged parts and assembly pictorial instructions are not all the same as that shown on the enclosed instruction sheet (upper bar shows a different scalloped hole design as what is actually produced) nor were there 2 plastic oval washers as delineated on the assembly instructions (there were two extra oval metal washers though that worked just fine).
customer_reviews.author: JCH

customer_reviews.title: Good pullup bar
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'8 and about 250 pounds, these pull-up bars have worked well for me so far. The door frame rests have scuffed the paint on the door a little bit, so I might recommend putting a towel under them or something to further pad them.
customer_reviews.author: Townscd

customer_reviews.title: I've put this thing through hell and its stood up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing over 6 months ago and I can still do pull ups on it hanging on my door frame. It hasn't really damaged my door frame too. I weigh about 250lbs and it works very well and securely for me. My kids use it as a swing with a stretch band on it, and it still works. We've pushed it to the limit and still its good. I'm very happy with this. Something to note: the blue washers between the bars have broken off after some extreme swinging. Other than that everything is brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Jaziel Exposito

customer_reviews.title: Great bar, hard on paint
customer_reviews.text: I love all the grip variations on the bar. After one use, the rubber stoppers that sit against the door frame did pull off chips of paint. This is my first pull-up bar so maybe that's normal. I'm giving the product for stars because I feel it's collateral damage that would happen with any doorway mounted bar.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J Trump

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for removable chin up bar
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy pull-up bar, perfect solution for my 14 year old son. Assembly took longer than expected, though fairly straight forward. Instead of step by step instructions, they provide an exploded view showing where pieces go. It's up to you to figure out what order the parts should be attached. Get the "cheater" INTEY Pull up Assist Bands to help your athlete work up to full body weight with proper technique.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Pull ups all day everyday
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I use it everyday! I also like how it also has extensions, not having to worry about buying a new one if i move to another place with wider doors. its has higher handles than the other pull up bars that I used in the past which is great! more effort doing the work out. the product feels really sturdy too, making me feel confident trying out pull up variations.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo Niccolo S. Yanga

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The directions were easy but I initially thought I would need the extensions for my doorway and it seemed like I would be short some washers if I did that. It turns out I didn’t need those extensions and finished the assembly in about 20-30 minutes. Seems pretty sturdy even for my fat ass. Those blue, plastic washers will be the first to go. Unless they’re made out of magic plastic that won’t age and crack apart from stress and time. We’ll see if I own this for a year or decade or until I’m dead...
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: This pullup bar is great. Very sturdy when assembled. Easy to assemble. You can do various types of exercises in confidence. Customer service was great too. Some parts were missing when it arrived, which was a little frustrating. But, I called and emailed customer service, and they Fedexed overnight the missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: glenno

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Some assembly required but not hart and it comes cute little tools. Take about 10-min to put together. Works like a champ and easily holds my 250# fat butt just fine. I bought this for daily stretching, and it exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: ITO

customer_reviews.title: When ur niece is with u haha
customer_reviews.text: It’s great, assembly 4 me would have been easier if my 1 1/2 old niece wasn’t with me but even that was fairly easy, range of motion is great both on a door frame and on the ground, even did a few with my niece on the other side just had 2 get my repetitions in sync with hers haha, I’ld say my sturdiness would b better if my door frames (house :() was younger then 1950, but even then the bar may give some with the frame, yet it still works good, just monitor ur reps, so yeaaaa if ur house is newer then that YOUR IN GREAT SHAPE!!! Haha
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: IT'S STRONGER THAN ME👍👍👍👍😉
customer_reviews.text: Ok this Product kicks serious Ars. WON'T JACK YOUR DOOR JAM OR WALLS UP. Super easy in & Out. But my big butt can only do 2 pullups. I'll update when i get to 3. Great engineering No Bs.💪😇🤘
customer_reviews.author: LAZARUS

customer_reviews.title: Solid product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product because I wanted to hang from a bar without my feet touching the ground. This ALMOST got me there. I'm about 6 foot. If your 5'8" or under you might be able to. I feel stronger and like I can pull with better form if that's the case. I can still do pullups on here fairly comfortably. I doubt you'll find a better doorway pull-up bar.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Kuczek

customer_reviews.title: Worth It/ Recommend
customer_reviews.text: As you can see I use it for more than just pull ups. I like the item. The set up/installation was pretty simple. I'm about 200 lbs and have know issues. I do believe it doesn't recommend over 200lbs but you may have to check other reviews as I set this up about a month and a half along with the instructions. I would recommend doing it though. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Moultrie

customer_reviews.title: Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: It stays in place. It's sturdy. The grips are good, not great, but good enough. I only us it as a pull up/stretching bar. I don't use it on the floor as a push up bar. It does the job with no frills.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly suprised. I have a super wide door and this works wonderful. It is crazy how it entends out so u are far away from the door. I have had several chinup bars and this one is the best by far, Trust me!!! This is a definite must buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: scottronitro

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy doorway exercise bar
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together It is very stable and is very easy to position for working out . When you need to access the door it is very easy to remove. No tools or dismantling needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With some modification good for thick doorways.
customer_reviews.text: My doorway is 9” thick with 6” molding. From the reviews I concluded there is no way it’s going to fit such a deep opening without modification. Ordered it anyway. So I had to make an extra hole approx 2.5” from the original one and now it fits right!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: So unhappy ! My girlfriend and I both couldn’t get this thing together! Completely blew my energy! Bolts stick and instructions are garbage !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bar
customer_reviews.text: I currently rent and was unsure about putting up a bar in my house. I like to work on different types of activities and this bar provides me with everything I need. No issues with making marks and I’m able to work different muscles. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: bjj

customer_reviews.title: nice height for 6'1 adult
customer_reviews.text: I choose this bar over others because I liked the way it curved up. I reach it fine but don't feel like I'm going to hit my knees on the ground. Looks well made, went together easily although the instructions are basicly just a picture. fits standard doorway well. I think this should work out well.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Family

customer_reviews.title: Potential to be great
customer_reviews.text: I found the product in good quality and well made. A little overpriced honestly. I’m not sure if there’s any problem with manufacturer since its symmetry is off 1/2 inch or so on the top bar, making it a little crooked - it’s not a huge deal, but again, you don’t want to be doing your excercises with one side pulling more than the other.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Large pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy with multiple pull up positions. Leaves suff marks on door and wall. Use a towel under where it comes in contact with surface too reduce scuffing.
customer_reviews.author: R Pelly

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is fairly easy. Between the written instructions and referring to the pictures of it on Amazon, I got is assembled. All the parts were in the box.
customer_reviews.author: PoppaG

customer_reviews.title: This bar is great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son who is 6'2". Best bar for his height and he liked it. Easy to assemble and use. Not only for pull-ups and chin-ups but also when placed on the ground for planks and push ups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best pull up bars out there!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and really sturdy. Gives extended range of motion as it hangs outside and above the door frame and that makes a significant difference!
customer_reviews.author: MUHAMMAD SAMIR

customer_reviews.title: Great product and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the cheaper ones. This is sturdy and works well on the door frame. I like the height too. I have to stand on tip toes to grab but I would rather do that than have to bend the knees. And no, you don't hit your head on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Van Smith

customer_reviews.title: Finally!!  This is the right one to buy !!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Door pull up bar that I have ever used period. It is very heavy plus it comes with an extension kit so that it will even fit my 38” door opening. Strongly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Neal Weber.

customer_reviews.title: Not as it seems, still functional.
customer_reviews.text: The pictures would suggest that it's some sort of like lightly colored brushed aluminum, but it's not. The pictures would also suggest that the blue washers are some sort of brushed aluminum of sorts, but they are just plastic. The pictures are absolutely false advertisement. That being said, I suppose it will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: beau duvall

customer_reviews.title: Great pull up bar that's worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to stay at home orders, but I should have bought it years ago. It was easy to assemble and even comes with all the tools you need (all you need is standard wrenches). It fits a standard door frame just fine even with lower ceilings. It has extenders for wider door frames. It takes seconds to install and remove. The grips are varied and comfortable. Having the bars rise above the door frame makes it much more functional.
customer_reviews.author: Alvy Singer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought one similar to this one at an sports store and it did not fit the door frame well, so we were really happy to find this pull up bar here . It fits our door perfectly, and it has bars that go up higher than the door frame so if you’re taller your feet don’t reach the floor, like they do in most others. We are satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment!!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy and exceeded my expectations. I weigh 195 and this handles my weight easily WITHOUT the slightest wiggle or squeaking. It can fit the standard doorway or a wider one with the supplied extensions. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Top5Percent

customer_reviews.title: Good Bar
customer_reviews.text: Quality bar for wider door frames. About $15 overpriced because it will leave marks on your door frame. Use a couple of hand towels wrapped around the ends and your in business.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Husband uses this daily
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using this for about a month. It did mess up the door frame a little, but all we do now is put a small piece of cardboard between the doorframe and the bar. Works great and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Quality parts and solid.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best door way pull up bar I have purchased so far. Good height, quality parts, easy to put together, and really sturdy. Very very good quality and able to handle my 195 lbs with no problem. No bending, very stiff and solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Stanford Chun

customer_reviews.title: Best Door Pull-Up Bar I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got lucky, but the one I got, once assembled, was the sturdiest door pull-up bar I've ever used. It was easy to put together, gives almost a foot more height, which helps get a full stretch, and more range of motion. This thing is fantastic, I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: mezzn

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and very sturdy. My husband is 6’2”, 205lbs. and it easily holds his weight. No damage to the door frame either. We had to use the extenders for our door frame. Easy instructions.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Grease the grove. Oh yes!
customer_reviews.text: I am six foot and always thought that doorway pull bars were a joke. I bough this with little expectation that it would actually work. To date I have been pleasantly surprised. I have been using it to grease the grove. My chin ups have gone form 13 strict dead hangs to 22 in six weeks. I love this bar.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best purchase I have made for exercise equipment. I have the $25 model and it felt so cramped between the door frame. This one Is so much better and feels more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: David Zinn

customer_reviews.title: I love having this at home
customer_reviews.text: I did my first pull up just a few years ago, it was about a year after I ran my first real mile. I like to do pullups during and after a good run. This bar is my new favorite thing. It goes up and comes down with great ease. It supports my weight and offers several pullup configurations. I recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: mykeysings

customer_reviews.title: IT’s AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This is pull up bar for all ages. Now i must say there is some assembly required!! it is strong sturdy and So much fun to climb on. trust me its worth your money. The weight isn’t on your door frame its on heavy duty metal supported by the door frame. No damage done to the door. It’s is a jungle gym in on pull up bar. I give this a 5 star rating because of how strong and fun it is. It is a high bar so short childern and adults it might be hard to reach but with a step ladder its the funniest thing in the house that you will ever own. ITS AWESOME!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elle E

product_meta.title: Ultimate Body Press XL Doorway Pull Up Bar with Elevated Bar & Adjustable Width
product_meta.description:
XL DOORWAY PULL UP BAR WITH ELEVATED BAR & ADJUSTABLE WIDTH
Get better workouts every day with the elevated XL Doorway Pull Up Bar by Ultimate Body Press. With wide diameter heavy steel tubing, premium hardware, exclusive ABS bar couplers and long lasting high density foam padding, The XL Doorway Pull Up Bar combines stable workouts with incredible range of motion. Three grip positions target individual muscle groups across the chest, arms, back and core with a super quick change over to floor exercises as a push up and dip stand and as a brace for sit ups. The elevated bar is great for taller users and gives you full range of motion for pull ups and expanded exercises with optional accessories like suspension trainers and ab straps (accessories sold separately). Expandable bar ends make the XL Doorway Pull Up Bar a universal fit for residential doorways 24 – 36” in width without screws or drilling. Assembly is straight forward with all hardware and tools provided and you can shop with confidence, the XL Doorway Pull Up Bar is backed with our 100% satisfaction guarantee.

PULL UP BAR FEATURES
• Get highly metabolic home workouts that build muscle across the chest, arms, back, and core – fast
• Workouts get effective results with pull-ups, push-ups, body weight rows, dips, and sit ups
• Premium construction with quality hardware and ABS tubing couplers means true stability on the wall and real rigidity for floor exercises
• Quickly switch between doorway and floor exercises. Universal-fit expandable bar ends fit all residential doorways 24" to 36" wide with molding up to 3.5" wide
• High density foam grips are long lasting and reduce strain for better workouts
• Build a full body gym with optional suspension trainers, ab straps and gymnastic rings (sold separately) without bulky equipment taking up space
• Bar leverages body weight to lock in doorways without drilling or screws and supports up to 300 pounds. Assembly is quick and easy with tools included
• Prime eligible shipping and Ultimate Body Press 100% Satisfaction Guarantee. You will love owning the this bar and the workouts, or we will refund your money. 

QUALITY CONSTRUCTION SUPPORTS THE RESULTS YOU WANT
Doorway pull up bars have rightfully earned the respect of fitness enthusiasts. Great workouts at home start with pull ups and the convenience of having you bar ready to go at a moment's notice makes it easy to build on your results daily. The addition of the elevated bar extends your range of motion and brings home the kind of performance you expect from the mounted bars at the gym. To handle the added leverage of the elevated bar, the Ultimate Body Press XL Pull Up Bar uses the thickest steel, quality hardware and our exclusive ABS couplers so each crossbar can be properly tightened and locked at 90° to the uprights. You feel the difference on the wall with every rep and most importantly, the XL Doorway Bar retains it's shape under strenuous floor exercises. The elevated doorway bar that supports your confidence leaves you free to focus on form and repetition for the results you want in less time. 

ANCHOR OPTIONAL PULL UP BAR ACCESSORIES
Add optional Ab Straps, Gymnastic Rings and Bodyweight Resistance Trainers to transform your Doorway Pull Up Bar into a complete home gym. Pull up bar accessories expand your favorite exercises with new compound movements and increase your rep counts to full sets with assisted exercise variations. If you are seeking a performance edge on the field, working up to your first pull up or rediscovering your best performance levels, pull up bar accessories get comprehensive results fast. (accessories sold separately) 

SHOP WITH CONFIDENCE
At Ultimate Body Press our passion is providing high quality affordable fitness equipment for real workouts that fit your spaces and how you like to exercise. We are proud to serve your gym needs and want to meet and exceed your expectations for customer service. If you need any assistance with your purchase, customer service has complete resources to assist you and is available by phone or email during regular business hours Monday-Friday. 

ORDER YOUR XL DOORWAY PULL UP BAR
The XL Doorway Pull Up Bar gives you better workouts every day for the results you want in less time. Your satisfaction is 100% guaranteed, order yours today.
feature_bullets: GET OUT OF THE DOORWAY: Effectively build muscle across the chest, arms, back, and core with pull-ups, push-ups, dips, and sit ups. Elevated Bar sets 1” above trim and 10” from wall to fully leverage your doorway opening for full range of motion

BUILT FOR REAL WORKOUTS: Premium heavy steel tubing supports up to 300 pounds. Exclusive ABS couplers secure a true, tight, and rigid frame. High density foam grips reduce strain for better workouts. Quickly switch between doorway and floor exercises

IDEAL ANCHOR FOR OPTIONAL ACCESSORIES: Build a full body gym with Ultimate Body Press Ab Straps and Gymnastic Rings for highly metabolic full body workouts and assisted pull up variations. (accessories sold separately)
DESIGNED IN THE USA: Ultimate Body Press is a North Carolina company committed to delivering better workouts every day. Includes Prime eligible shipping, 30 day returns, and USA customer service
SHOP WITH CONFIDENCE: The Elevated Doorway Pull Up Bar is backed by Ultimate Body Press against manufacturer's defects for 10 years

EASY INSTALLATION: Bar installs in seconds with no drilling. Fits residential doorways 6 inches deep when measured from trim face to trim face. Expandable bar ends fit doorways 24" to 36" wide with molding up to 3.5" wide
